title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:

title: Hands-on Exercise 00 : working with tidyverse
text:
Getting Started
Loading tidyverse onto r environment by using the code chunk below.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)



Importing data

realis2019 <- read_csv("data/REALIS2019.csv")


popdata_fat <- read_csv("data/PopData2019_fat.csv")



Pivoting data

popdata_long <- popdata_fat %>%
  pivot_longer(c(3:21),
               names_to = "Age Group",
               values_to = "Population")



Export and Import R data files(.rds)

#|eval: FALSE
write_rds(popdata_long, "data/popData_long.rds")


#|echo: FALSE
popdata_long <- read_rds("data/popdata_long.rds")



Select and filter columns

realis2019_filtered <- realis2019 %>%
select(`Project Name`, `Type of Sale`, `Transacted Price ($)`, `Property Type`, `Unit Price ($ psm)`) %>%
  filter(`Property Type` == "Condominium"| 
           `Property Type` == "Apartment") %>%
  filter(`Type of Sale` == "New Sale") %>%
  filter(`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 11000)

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text:
pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, 
               ggthemes, hrbrthemes,
               tidyverse) 





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")








The plotThe code














ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(color = "darkslategray3") +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  geom_label_repel(aes(label = ID), 
                   fontface = "bold") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")









The plotThe code














ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  theme_bw() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") 







The plotThe code














ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_economist()








The plotThe code














ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="deepskyblue3", 
                 fill="darkslategray3") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum()





The plotThe code














ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="cyan4", 
                 fill="azure1") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum(axis_title_size = 18,
              base_size = 15,
              grid = "Y")









The plotThe code














p1 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="deepskyblue3", 
                 fill="darkslategray3") + 
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")





The plotThe code














p2 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="deepskyblue3", 
                 fill="darkslategray3") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of English scores")





The plotThe code














p3 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x= MATHS, 
                 y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(color = "darkslategray3") +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) + 
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores vs. Maths scores for Primary 3")







The plotThe code














p1 + p2








The plotThe code














(p1 / p2) | p3








The plotThe code














(p1 / p2) | p3








The plotThe code














p3 + inset_element(p2, 
                   left = 0.02, 
                   bottom = 0.7, 
                   right = 0.5, 
                   top = 1)








The plotThe code














patchwork <- (p1 / p2) | p3
patchwork & theme_pander() & theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size=8, margin = margin(t=5)),#above
                          axis.title.y = element_text(size=8, margin = margin(r=5)),
                          axis.text.x = element_text(size = 8),  
                          axis.text.y = element_text(size = 6),
                          plot.title = element_text(size = 10))

title: Hands-on Exercise 3
text:
pacman::p_load(ggiraph, plotly, 
               patchwork, DT, tidyverse) 





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")








p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive(
    aes(tooltip = ID),
    stackgroups = TRUE, 
    binwidth = 1, 
    method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, 
                     breaks = NULL)
girafe(
  ggobj = p,
  width_svg = 6,
  height_svg = 6*0.618
)












exam_data$tooltip <- c(paste0(     
  "Name = ", exam_data$ID,         
  "\n Class = ", exam_data$CLASS)) 

p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive(
    aes(tooltip = exam_data$tooltip), 
    stackgroups = TRUE,
    binwidth = 1,
    method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,               
                     breaks = NULL)
girafe(
  ggobj = p,
  width_svg = 8,
  height_svg = 8*0.618
)









tooltip <- function(y, ymax, accuracy = .01) {
  mean <- scales::number(y, accuracy = accuracy)
  sem <- scales::number(ymax - y, accuracy = accuracy)
  paste("Mean maths scores:", mean, "+/-", sem)
}

gg_point <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
                   aes(x = RACE),
) +
  stat_summary(aes(y = MATHS, 
                   tooltip = after_stat(  
                     tooltip(y, ymax))),  
    fun.data = "mean_se", 
    geom = GeomInteractiveCol,  
    fill = "light blue"
  ) +
  stat_summary(aes(y = MATHS),
    fun.data = mean_se,
    geom = "errorbar", width = 0.2, linewidth = 0.2
  )

girafe(ggobj = gg_point,
       width_svg = 8,
       height_svg = 8*0.618)









p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive(           
    aes(data_id = CLASS),             
    stackgroups = TRUE,               
    binwidth = 1,                        
    method = "histodot") +               
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,               
                     breaks = NULL)
girafe(                                  
  ggobj = p,                             
  width_svg = 6,                         
  height_svg = 6*0.618                      
)               









p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +

)

tooltip <- function(y, ymax, accuracy = .01) {
  mean <- scales::number(y, accuracy = accuracy)
  sem <- scales::number(ymax - y, accuracy = accuracy)
  paste("Mean maths scores:", mean, "+/-", sem)
}

  scale_colour_manual(values = country_colors) +

  labs(title = 'Year: {frame_time}',

          y = ~Young, 
          size = ~Population,

          sizes = c(2, 100),
          frame = ~Year, 
          text = ~Country, 
          hoverinfo = "text",
